Live and... Mong?
Who'd want to meet meat?
Live and drink.
There was something else...
You mentioned goodies?
Meat??
Show me your wares.
Let's trade.
What is the nature of your work here?
What work are you doing here, again?
What does that have to do with raising the dead?
Remind me why you're raising the dead?
Is there anything I can do to assist your work?
Is there anything I can do to help?
Is there something I can do to help you?
Do you have any work for me?
I will do as you ask.
I will do this for you.
I will do this for you.
I will complete this task.
No, I will not do this.
No I will not do this for you.
I refuse this task.
This isn't the job for me.
You move like wounded prey.
I sense that your entire form, both body and mind, is wreathed in chaos.
Are you alright? You look sickly.
Not taking to the implants well?
Why do you call me rare meat?
Why do you call me prime meat?
Why do you call me grey meat?
Why do you call me meat?

start.text:
Oh ho! I see you've brought that slavering failure of an attempt to ascertain.
Try to keep its leaking everywhere away from my equipment.
I don't want its mank griming up my work.

Why if it isn't the meat that fancies itself nobility.~ Do you have to have all of those machines implanted? They make perfoming vivisections so annoying.~ Does the rare meat wish to purchase more meat? Perhaps there's a goodie or two you could use.~ You'd be better served 'becoming' my test subject.

Your biology is so......unstable, fasinating.~ May I have a limb or two, you can surely spare at least one.~ So much material to work with!!!~ Would you like to purchase a snack, gargantuan meat? There must be something here to your liking.

Grey meat, the second worst kind, so little viable material.~ When your mind is inevitably consumed by sights older than sight, may I have your remains?~ Would you like to purchase something? Perhaps it can provide a little comfort while you cower from unseen "eyes".~ One wrong step and I activate my normalitly field.
Salutations, meat.~ May I have your legs? I promise to return them.~ Would you kindly lay upon this table here, I assure you that it is entirly safe.~ Would you like to purchase something, meat?

node.text: Oh, the liege lord wants of =player.possessive= subject?
The beast speaks.
As a gray worm in my ear, I'm sure.
Out with it then, meat.

The nature of my work?....What a finely uttered question, the aim of my work is simple "aristocrat" to make your kind obsolete, to develop a new line of cybernetics.
One that isn't locked behind 1000 year old protocols, one that doesn't require a disgusting immutable genome to safety interface. Your days as the sole beings able to cleanly integrate with Chrome are at an end.

The nature of my work? it is simple Prime meat, my aim is to develop a new line of cybernetics, one capable of being implanted even by those with radically unstable biology.
Can you imagine it, an augmentation underneath each of your many appendages all making you stronger, faster, more efficient.........

The nature of my work? My, you are actually capable of using your mind for something beyond killing others. I applaud the restraint and truly unfathomable cognitive complexity it must have taken to ask such an insightful question.
If you must know, I wish to create a new line of implants that do not cause sickness upon implantation. Perhaps you'd be interested? After all, it's not as though your hyper-active brain actually confers even a modicum of intellect.
Cranial augmentation may be your only hope. Lest you languish in idiocy like everyone else who isn't me.

The nature of my work? It is simple, meat: I wish to create a new line of cybernetic augmentations that do not reject our shared physiology.
Imagine it now meat, no longer being restricted to the random permutations of your genome, finally being able to choose your own capabilities. Is that not wonderful?

Trial and error I'm afraid, before I can understand how to create a new line, I must ascertain exactly how and why our shared biology almost unilaterally rejects cybernetics.
It was my initial theory that deadflesh with it essentially being in a state of genetic stasis would be less likely to manifest negative effects. I've unfortunately seen little success in that endeavor.

Test subjects primarily. Perhaps if you continue asking questions, I'll introduce you to my research directly.
The immutable nature of your physical form, akin to those filthy augmented wretches, may have some valuable applications despite the overall uselessness of your flesh.

My first attempt at development. I've unfortunately gleaned little from my experiments with the reanimated dead. At least they make excellent slaves,
{{Y|Most}} of them anyways.

The walking relic wants to help me replace it, how grand. Very well rare meat, there is actually something you could do to assist.
My current experimentation with forcibly installing cybernetic augments into walking corpses has yielded little fruit, with a few exceptions, nearly all of the corpses I tested rapidly dissolved into viscera.
However, certain corpses took longer to lose integrity than others, I would like you to gather some of these 'implant-tolerant' cadavers.
I need the most resistant material available for my next round of experiments. I require 3 corpses out of this list, (random creature list of 10 goes here), find these creatures, kill them and then bring me what remains.
I will provide you with a suitable reward upon completion of this task.

Why yes there is, prime meat. Your gargantuan form should be well-suited to this task.
My current experimentation with forcibly augmenting walking corpses has largely failed. Barring a small number of exceptions, nearly every live corpse I augmented rapidly dissolved into paste.
While every attempt did eventually end in abject failure, a tiny minority of corpses survived longer than the others before liquefying.
I would like you to bring me some of these implant-tolerant cadavers. I am going to change my approach and require the most resistant material available
I require three corpses out of this list, (list of 10 random creatures goes here) find the appropriate creatures, kill them and bring me what is left.
I will provide you with a suitable reward upon completion of this task.

Would you look at that, your middling physic powers have finally done something useful. Why yes, I do need help.
My current line of experimentation has a hit a wall more resilient than the cage of your winged-predators' master.
Nearly every single corpse I have tried to augment has instantly dissolved into paste, I wish to try a new approach and require additional material to do so.
This list contains a series of creatures which through previous experiments I've found are slightly more resistant to the liquefying effects of augmentation, I would like you to locate three of these creatures, kill them and then bring the rotting husks to me for testing.
Upon completion of this task, I will provide you with a suitable reward.

If by 'work' you mean making revolutionary strides in the field of cybernetics then yes, I have work for you meat.
I know you are mediocrity made form so I'll try to keep this simple. I need more material for my experiments, all my previous attempts to augment reanimated corpses has ended in failure.
I require stronger material, this list contains a total number of 10 possible targets. I need you to retrieve the corpses of 3. How you do so is irrelevant, all that matters is that I have the meat I require.
Once you have completed this paltry task I will grant you a suitable reward.
Then get to it rare meat, the future irrelevance of your wretched people lies in your annoyingly stable hands.
Thank you prime meat, please try to complete this task as quickly as you are able, the future waits for no one, not even meat as physically formidable as yourself.
Thank you grey meat, despite the utter inadequacy of your intellect, at the very least you see the value in obeying your better.
Well then get to it meat, it's not like you have anything better to do.

choice.text: I'll get to it then!

node.text: Then why are you still here? Go pollute somewhere else with your foul presence!

You may be prime meat, but that doesn't make you any less my subordinate.
Do as I ask or it will no longer be a choice.

choice.text: Rude...

node.text: If that's the case why don't you take a seat on my nearby vivisection table, your usefulness to me as an intact being has expired!!!!

choice.text: Fine. Okay... But what do I get out of it?
{{emote|*This is me concentrating you to death*}}

node.text: If that's the case then your usefulness to me as a traditionally living creature has come to a close, any resistance will be met with pain upon pain.

choice.text: Fine. Okay... But what do I get out of it?
Throw hands!

node.text:
What is pain besides another word for progress. With the power of my vast genius I found a way to bypass those damned restrictions on one of the many millennium-old chrome surgeons scattered throughout this land.
I however didn't anticipate that my very physiology would reject augmentation, though it's irrelevant, I will find a way, no matter how much material it takes!!

You figure that out all by yourself? Why don't use your nigh-omniscient extra-sensory gaze to tell me more obvious things.
The pain and instability are small prices to pay for my inevitable cybernetic ascension, though I suppose you wouldn't know the value of such a pursuit. Having a mind nearly as small as your body's capacity for mutation after all.

Silence meat. I, and I alone, determine what is sick and what is healthy!
My current impaired state is just the first step of my inevitable transformation into the perfect fusion of bodily permutation and cybernetic augmentation!!
Oh go drink piss, you worthless piece of obsolete trash!!!! I'll show you who wears them better!!!

choice.text: You could certainly try!
Whoa! Hold on!
Whoa! Hold on...
Sorry...

node.text: Rare meat, yes, though rare may be a misnomer, I speak only in terms of the difficulty of finding materials like yours, not to the value that they provide; worthless meat may be a more accurate descriptor.
Prime meat, yes, for your body is as ever-changing and adapting as my unfathomablely vast intellect, so much room for error too, so much excess material. You are the height of usefulness to me.

Grey meat, yes, for only your brain is of interest to me. The rest of you is as immutable as the form of those worthless and yet tantalizingly metal-laced animals who strut around as though they are the children of gods.
Meat, yes, would you prefer I say materials, components, resources? You are a walking sack of things I find moderately useful. Be grateful I've decided not to harvest you for the time being.
